intro: Xanthoxalis, commonly known as false goldenroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their yellow-orange flowers and are native to various regions in the Americas. Many species of Xanthoxalis have finely divided leaves that resemble those of other plants in the family. They often grow in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks. Some species are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
